alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Breathitt County through 530 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Curt, or near Jackson, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Inverness and Haddix around 500 PM EDT. Jackson, Quicksand, Dumont, Lost Creek and Flintville around 505 PM EDT. Portsmouth, Noctor, Smith Branch and Wilstacy around 510 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Haginsville, Press, Stevenson and Sikes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
